title: Berg Balance Scale (BBS)
description: Assesses balance and fall risk in community-dwelling older adults through 14 functional tasks

parameters.name: sitting_to_standing
parameters.description: Ability to move from sitting to standing position
options: 0 - Unable to stand without help or falls when attempting to stand
1 - Needs minimal help to stand or stabilize
2 - Able to stand using hands after several tries
3 - Able to stand independently using hands
4 - Able to stand without using hands and stabilize independently

parameters.name: standing_unsupported
parameters.description: Ability to stand unsupported for 2 minutes
options: 0 - Unable to stand 30 seconds unassisted
1 - Needs several tries to stand 30 seconds unsupported
2 - Able to stand 30 seconds unsupported
3 - Able to stand 2 minutes with supervision
4 - Able to stand safely 2 minutes

parameters.name: sitting_unsupported
parameters.description: Ability to sit with back unsupported but feet supported on floor for 2 minutes
options: 0 - Unable to sit without support 10 seconds
1 - Able to sit 10 seconds
2 - Able to sit 30 seconds
3 - Able to sit 2 minutes under supervision
4 - Able to sit safely and securely 2 minutes

parameters.name: standing_to_sitting
options: 0 - Needs help to sit
1 - Sits independently but has uncontrolled descent
2 - Uses back of legs against chair to control descent
3 - Controls descent by using hands
4 - Sits safely with minimal use of hands

parameters.name: transfers
parameters.description: Ability to transfer from one chair to another
options: 0 - Cannot transfer safely with or without help
1 - Needs help to transfer
2 - Able to transfer with verbal cuing and/or supervision
3 - Able to transfer safely but needs hands for support
4 - Able to transfer safely without using hands

parameters.name: standing_eyes_closed
parameters.description: Ability to stand unsupported with eyes closed for 10 seconds
options: 0 - Needs help to keep from falling
1 - Unable to keep eyes closed 3 seconds but stays steady
2 - Able to stand 3 seconds
3 - Able to stand 10 seconds with supervision
4 - Able to stand 10 seconds safely

parameters.name: standing_feet_together
parameters.description: Ability to stand unsupported with feet together
options: 0 - Needs help to attain position and unable to hold for 15 seconds
1 - Needs help to attain position but able to stand 15 seconds feet together
2 - Able to place feet together independently but unable to hold for 30 seconds
3 - Able to place feet together independently and stand 1 minute with supervision
4 - Able to place feet together independently and stand 1 minute safely

parameters.name: reaching_forward
parameters.description: Reaching forward with outstretched arm while standing
options: 0 - Loses balance while trying/requires external support
1 - Reaches forward but needs supervision
2 - Can reach forward >5 cm (2 inches) safely
3 - Can reach forward >12.5 cm (5 inches) safely
4 - Can reach forward confidently >25 cm (10 inches)

parameters.name: picking_up_object
parameters.description: Pick up object from the floor from a standing position
options: 0 - Unable to try/needs assistance to keep from losing balance or falling
1 - Unable to pick up and needs supervision while trying
2 - Unable to pick up but reaches 2-5 cm (1-2 inches) from slipper and keeps balance independently
3 - Able to pick up slipper but needs supervision
4 - Able to pick up slipper safely and easily

parameters.name: turning_to_look_behind
parameters.description: Turning to look behind over left and right shoulders while standing
options: 0 - Needs assistance to keep from losing balance or falling
1 - Needs supervision when turning
2 - Turns sideways only but maintains balance
3 - Looks behind one side only other side shows less weight shift
4 - Looks behind from both sides and weight shifts well

parameters.name: turning_360_degrees
options: 0 - Needs assistance while turning
1 - Needs close supervision or verbal cuing
2 - Able to turn 360 degrees safely but slowly
3 - Able to turn 360 degrees safely one side only <4 seconds
4 - Able to turn 360 degrees safely in <4 seconds both sides

parameters.name: placing_alternate_foot_on_step
parameters.description: Place alternate foot on step or stool while standing unsupported
options: 0 - Needs assistance to keep from falling/unable to try
1 - Able to place one foot on step/stool, needs supervision
2 - Able to place foot up and down 2 times, needs minimal support
3 - Able to place foot up and down 4 times without support but needs supervision
4 - Able to place foot up and down 8 times independently and safely

parameters.name: standing_one_foot_in_front
parameters.description: Standing unsupported one foot in front
options: 0 - Loses balance while stepping or standing
1 - Needs help to step but can hold 15 seconds
2 - Able to take small step independently and hold 30 seconds
3 - Able to place foot ahead independently and hold 30 seconds
4 - Able to place foot tandem independently and hold 30 seconds

parameters.name: standing_on_one_leg
options: 0 - Unable to lift leg or tries to lift leg but loses balance in <3 seconds
1 - Able to lift leg independently but cannot hold >3 seconds
2 - Able to lift leg independently and hold >3 but <10 seconds
3 - Able to lift leg independently and hold 10 seconds or more but <30 seconds
4 - Able to lift leg independently and hold for >30 seconds

result.name: bbs_score
result.description: Berg Balance Scale total score from 0 (high fall risk) to 56 (excellent balance)

ranges.interpretation: Score indicates severe balance impairment typically requiring wheelchair use. Extremely high fall risk. Requires maximum assistance for mobility and safety.

ranges.description: Significant balance impairment requiring walking aid
ranges.interpretation: Score indicates significant balance impairment requiring walking aids (walker, cane) and assistance. High fall risk. Close supervision needed for mobility activities.

ranges.description: Moderate balance impairment with increased fall risk
ranges.interpretation: Score indicates moderate balance impairment with increased fall risk. May benefit from assistive devices and fall prevention interventions. Requires some supervision for safety.

ranges.description: Good balance with low fall risk
ranges.interpretation: Score indicates good functional balance with low fall risk. Generally safe for independent mobility. Continue balance maintenance exercises and periodic reassessment.

references: Berg KO, Wood-Dauphinee SL, Williams JI, Maki B. Measuring balance in the elderly: validation of an instrument. Can J Public Health. 1992 Jul-Aug;83 Suppl 2:S7-11.
Berg K, Wood-Dauphinee S, Williams JI, Gayton D. Measuring balance in the elderly: preliminary development of an instrument. Physiother Can. 1989;41:304-311.
Bogle Thorbahn LD, Newton RA. Use of the Berg Balance Scale to predict falls in elderly persons. Phys Ther. 1996 Jun;76(6):576-83; discussion 584-5.
formula: BBS Score = Sum of all 14 task scores (each scored 0-4 points)
notes: Requires equipment: 2 chairs, stopwatch, step/footstool, ruler, shoe/slipper
Score <40 associated with almost 100% fall risk
Score ≤36 is 100% predictive of falls within 6 months in geriatric population
May have ceiling effect for mildly impaired individuals
Should not be used alone to determine fall risk - consider age, comorbidities, and setting
Designed for community-dwelling older adults and patients with neurological conditions
